Quaking Karen Matthews had a pot of steaming mushy peas dumped over her head by a disgusted mum after she left a chippie. 
Matthews gorges herself on £4.50 fish suppers from her local takeaway three times a week. 
But she was hit with the gloopy mess just days before the new TV drama The Moorside about her vile crimes was aired. 
An angry woman followed her out of the chippie and dumped the peas over her head and as the serving slowly dipped down onto her duffel coat she ranted: “You evil b****. I’m a mother too.” 
“Karen thinks this is just the start and wonders now how many more attacks she’ll suffer,” says a source close to her. Read More Shannon Matthews' deluded kidnapper insists he was only 'looking after' abducted nine-year-old Karen had mushy peas thrown over her (Photo: Getty) 
“She was glad it was just a few peas but next time it could be worse. She was living quite a peaceful life until this programme came along. 
"But Karen being Karen, she doesn’t think it is anything to do with what she did by kidnapping her daughter.” 
Matthews, 41, is living in fear after the hit new BBC show, where she’s played by Game of Thrones star Gemma Whelan. Shannon Matthews was kidnapped by her own mum (Photo: PA) 
The source claims she watched last week’s first episode and logged on to social media afterwards to see dozens of death threats after the BBC1 programme finished. 
Matthews was living in Dewsbury, West Yorkshire, when she hit headlines in 2008 after pretending her daughter Shannon, nine, had been kidnapped. 
The BBC1 show, which continues this week, reveals how Matthews sat back and allowed police and friends to organise search parties for Shannon for almost a month – knowing she was being held less than two miles away in the dingy flat of her partner’s uncle Micahel Donovan.
